metadata.title: CVE-2019-11486 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The Siemens R3964 line discipline driver in drivers/tty/n_r3964.c in theLinux kernel before 5.0.8 has multiple race conditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11486` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1044-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1044.47
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1062-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1062.69
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-gke - 4.15.0-1041.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1011-gke - 5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1014-azure - 5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1042-gcp - 4.15.0-1042.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1043-kvm - 4.15.0-1043.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-oem - 4.15.0-1056.65
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1044.47').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1062.69').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1042.45').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1043.43').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.65').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25').
